chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas A Manley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Thomas A Manley in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Complaint filed in 14 CF 531, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 14 CF 531 and Ct. 1 in 14 CF 582, Judgment to be entered, 14 CF 582, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 dismissed, Court sentences defendant to: 14 CF 531, Ct. 1, 60 days jail w/Huber, conecutive, forthwith, $443.00 costs, $282.96 Restitution to be converted into civil judgment, 14 CF 582, Ct. 1, 60 days jail w/Huber, consecutive, $443.00 costs, 14 CF 531, may serve sentence in Sauk County, 4 days sentence credit, 14 CF 582, 43 days sentence credit
and Notice of DNA and Witness List with Petition filed by ADA Yaskal
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus for Sauk County Jail on 1/30/15 at 2:45 P.M.
and Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
For Preservation of Evidence filed by Atty. Riek
